components.name: Web Frontend
components.description: The frontend is a single-page application (SPA) built with React. It handles user interactions, displays data, and sends requests to the backend API.

components.name: RESTful API Backend
components.description: The backend is built using Node.js and Express. It exposes a RESTful API for the frontend to consume. It handles business logic, authentication, and authorization.

components.name: Relational Database
components.description: The database stores application data. It is a PostgreSQL instance, providing structured data storage and retrieval.

data_flows.description: User interactions (e.g., form submissions, button clicks) are sent as HTTP requests to the backend API.
The backend retrieves and stores data in the database.
The backend sends data to the frontend for display.

trust_boundaries.name: Frontend Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The frontend is considered a low-trust zone. It should only receive data from the backend and should not handle sensitive operations directly.

trust_boundaries.name: Backend Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The backend is a higher-trust zone, handling authentication, authorization, and business logic.
